name: Invesco S&P Emerging Markets Low Volatility ETF
description: The Invesco S&P Emerging Markets Low Volatility ETF (EMLP) is an exchange-traded fund designed to provide investors with exposure to low-volatility stocks in emerging market economies. Launched in 2014, this ETF tracks the S&P BMI Emerging Markets Low Volatility Index, which consists of stocks that exhibit lower price volatility relative to the broader emerging markets universe. EMLP aims to capture the performance of these less volatile companies, which are often characterized by more stable earnings and dividends, making it an attractive option for risk-conscious investors seeking growth in emerging markets. The fund invests in a diversified portfolio of equities across various sectors, including financials, consumer staples, and utilities, among others. By focusing on lower volatility stocks, EMLP seeks to mitigate the risks associated with investing in emerging markets, which can be more susceptible to economic and political changes. As part of Invesco's suite of ETFs, EMLP is managed with a focus on cost efficiency and transparency, providing investors with an accessible way to gain exposure to this unique segment of the market. The ETF’s strategy aligns with the growing trend of investors seeking to balance risk and reward in their portfolios, particularly in the context of the increasing volatility often seen in emerging economies.

products: Invesco S&P Emerging Markets Low Volatility ETF

faq.question: What is the investment strategy of EMLP?
faq.answer: EMLP seeks to track the performance of low-volatility stocks in emerging markets, aiming to reduce risk while providing growth.
